title: Today’s very awkward handcuff stunt
text:
A HARMLESS prank has backfired spectacularly on Today Extra, leaving hosts Sonia Kruger and David Campbell forced to host the show this morning handcuffed together. 
Or so they’d have us believe. 
The pair first revealed the “prank” during their regular pre-show preview on the Today set with Lisa Wilkinson and Karl Stefanovic. 
“There’s something weird going on over here,” Stefanovic remarked. 
Campbell claimed that they had taken part in what was supposed to be a “two-minute prank” in which Kruger handcuffed herself to him because he was late to work. 
“We thought it’d be hilarious ... but we’ve broken the key off in the lock,” Kruger wailed. . @SoniaKruger and @DavidCampbell73 's handcuff prank didn't exactly go to plan! 😂 #9Today pic.twitter.com/AgitkR1LvJ — The Today Show (@TheTodayShow) February 8, 2017 
While news.com.au is fairly sceptical that the pair really are chained together without any form of escape, the hosts have certainly committed to the gag. 
They reappeared — still attached — at the start of the show, and continued to lament their predicament throughout the rest of the morning. What’s going on here? Source: Channel 9 
Kruger even complained Campbell wasn’t able to control his bladder during their captivity — telling the visiting stars of Suits during their interview: “He has been [to the toilet] ... and I was kind of outside.” 
Lovely. 
However, the real pièce de résistance was Campbell’s duet with The Voice ’s Harrison Craig — featuring a very awkward Kruger.
